snippet: The guidelines encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.
abstract: Obama administration releases its long-awaited nutritional guidelines for snack foods sold in schools, in effort to combat obesity in school-age children; guidelines, which set minimum requirements for calories and fats allowed, encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.
lead_paragraph: The guidelines encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.

headline.seo: U.S. Releases Nutritional Rules for Snacks at Schools
headline.main: U.S. Releases New Rules for School Snack Foods
headline.print_headline: U.S. Releases New Rules For School Snack Foods
